publicFunctions.argsString: (const thrust::detail::execution_policy_base< DerivedPolicy > &exec, InputIterator first, InputIterator last, UnaryFunction f)
publicFunctions.details: for_each applies the function object f to each element in the range [first, last); f's return value, if any, is ignored. Unlike the C++ Standard Template Library function std::for_each, this version offers no guarantee on order of execution. For this reason, this version of for_each does not return a copy of the function object. The algorithm's execution is parallelized as determined by exec. The following code snippet demonstrates how to use for_each to print the elements of a thrust::device_vector using the thrust::device parallelization policy: ```cpp #include #include #include #include ... struct printf_functor { __host__ __device__ void operator()(int x) { // note that using printf in a __device__ function requires // code compiled for a GPU with compute capability 2.0 or // higher (nvcc --arch=sm_20) printf("%d\n", x); } }; ... thrust::device_vector d_vec(3); d_vec[0] = 0; d_vec[1] = 1; d_vec[2] = 2; thrust::for_each(thrust::device, d_vec.begin(), d_vec.end(), printf_functor()); // 0 1 2 is printed to standard output in some unspecified order ```
publicFunctions.name: for_each

paramList.name: exec
paramList.text: The execution policy to use for parallelization.

paramList.name: f
paramList.text: The function object to apply to the range [first, last).

templateParamsList.name: DerivedPolicy
templateParamsList.text: The name of the derived execution policy.

templateParamsList.name: InputIterator
templateParamsList.text: is a model of Input Iterator, and InputIterator'svalue_type is convertible to UnaryFunction'sargument_type.

templateParamsList.name: UnaryFunction
templateParamsList.text: is a model of Unary Function, and UnaryFunction does not apply any non-constant operation through its argument.

publicFunctions.title: for_each

publicFunctions.argsString: (const thrust::detail::execution_policy_base< DerivedPolicy > &exec, InputIterator first, Size n, UnaryFunction f)
publicFunctions.details: for_each_n applies the function object f to each element in the range [first, first + n); f's return value, if any, is ignored. Unlike the C++ Standard Template Library function std::for_each, this version offers no guarantee on order of execution. The algorithm's execution is parallelized as determined by exec. The following code snippet demonstrates how to use for_each_n to print the elements of a device_vector using the thrust::device parallelization policy. ```cpp #include #include #include #include struct printf_functor { __host__ __device__ void operator()(int x) { // note that using printf in a __device__ function requires // code compiled for a GPU with compute capability 2.0 or // higher (nvcc --arch=sm_20) printf("%d\n", x); } }; ... thrust::device_vector d_vec(3); d_vec[0] = 0; d_vec[1] = 1; d_vec[2] = 2; thrust::for_each_n(thrust::device, d_vec.begin(), d_vec.size(), printf_functor()); // 0 1 2 is printed to standard output in some unspecified order ```

paramList.name: n
paramList.text: The size of the input sequence.
